# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (9) of 2025
Concerning the Rules and Regulations for Organizing the Process of Medical Advertisements
for Pharmaceutical Centers, Places, and Shops in the Private
Sector

The Minister of Health:
- Having reviewed the provisions of Law No. 28 of 1996 regarding
the Regulation of the Pharmacy Profession and the Circulation of Medicines, as amended by Law No. 30 of
2016, and their executive regulations.
- And the provisions of Articles 15, 16, 73, 74, and 85 of Law
No. 70 of 2020 concerning the Practice of the Medical Profession and its Ancillary Professions,
Patients' Rights, and Health Facilities.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. 87 of 2023 concerning the Rules and Regulations
for Organizing the Process of Medical Advertisements in the Private Sector.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. 278 of 2019 concerning the Prices and Fees
of Health Services.
- And based on the Ministry's desire to establish controls for organizing the process of medical advertisements
for pharmaceutical centers and shops in the private sector.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest, and what has been presented to us by the Undersecretary
of the Ministry.

## Has Decided
### Article One
**Definitions:**
1.  **Pharmaceutical Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig>:** A pharmacy, warehouse, drug factory,
    scientific office for medicines, or the headquarters of a company for importing and exporting medicines or
    medical products.
2.  **Shop <orig>محل البيع</orig>:** Entities licensed by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> to display,
    circulate, or sell food supplements, health products,
    veterinary medicines, or veterinary preparations.
3.  **Places <orig>الأماكن</orig>:** Locations where medicines, health products,
    food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic
    materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies related to the health or aesthetic
    aspects of humans or animals are displayed, circulated, or sold
    without obtaining a license from the Ministry
    of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

### Article Two
For the purposes of implementing the provisions of this resolution, an advertisement shall be considered any announcement for a Pharmaceutical
Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig> or a Shop <orig>محل البيع</orig>, or any announcement of any material or content, regardless of
its form or type, published with the intent to promote medicines, health
products, food supplements, special foods, herbal
preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies
related to the health or aesthetic aspects of humans or animals, or
their sale prices, whether such publication is made by practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its
ancillary professions, the Pharmaceutical Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig>, Shops <orig>محال البيع</orig>, their license holders, or
their managers, or through a third party, provided it is done at the direct or
indirect request of the aforementioned parties, and whether such publication is for a fee or
free of charge. Publication shall not be made through any means of advertising,
whether print, audio, visual, or other fixed or
mobile means of publication.

### Article Three
The provisions of this resolution shall also apply to advertisements for the materials and products
referred to in Article Two of this resolution published on platforms of websites,
electronic applications, and social media sites, whether through
the approved accounts of Pharmaceutical Centers <orig>المراكز الصيدلانية</orig> or Shops <orig>محال البيع</orig>, accounts
designated for commercial advertisements, display platforms, accounts of
social media influencers, or the personal accounts
of practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, or other accounts
on social media sites.

### Article Four
Practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, and license holders of
a Pharmaceutical Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig> or Shops <orig>محال البيع</orig>, are not permitted to advertise the prices of the materials and products
referred to in Article Two of this resolution, whether by posting at
the Pharmaceutical Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig>, Places <orig>أماكن</orig>, or Shops <orig>محال البيع</orig> through any means of advertising
and publication, whether the advertisement is made directly by them or through others
in any form, and whether for a fee or free of charge,
without first obtaining a license to do so from the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of
the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, in accordance with the provisions of this
resolution.

### Article Five
It is not permitted to advertise the sale prices of medicines or products referred to in
Article Two of this resolution outside the premises of the Pharmaceutical Center <orig>المركز الصيدلي</orig> or the Shop <orig>محل البيع</orig>
through any of the advertising means referred to in Article Three without first
obtaining a license to do so in accordance with the provisions of this resolution.

  "page_summary": "This page outlines regulations for advertising pharmaceutical and food products, covering rules for pharmacies, medical professionals, social media influencers, and the types of claims and terms prohibited. It also details the process for obtaining advertising licenses and the responsibilities of advertisers regarding accuracy and compliance."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1722 Seventy-First Year
67
Sunday, 19 Rajab 1446 AH - 19/1/2025 AD
</header>
## Article Six

The pharmaceutical center, practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, or the licensed retail outlet may not advertise themselves, their specializations, their place of work, and the services they provide during the validity period of their licenses and the licenses of the professionals working for them, except after obtaining a valid advertising license in accordance with the provisions of this Decision.

## Article Seven

It is not permissible to advertise discounts, offers, installment payments, or any other facilities before obtaining a license to do so in accordance with the provisions of this Decision. Excluded from this are volunteer campaigns licensed to advertise, provided that approval is obtained from the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> and from other competent government authorities.

## Article Eight

It is prohibited for third parties to photograph or publish the patient, consumer, or professional practitioner while they are present at the pharmaceutical center or retail outlet, for any reason and by any means.

## Article Nine

The advertiser is prohibited from promoting medical illusion by claiming superiority or precedence and using non-medical terms for any medicine, medical product, or the skill of practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, or what suggests such, including but not limited to (the first / the newest / the best / the only / the optimal / the fastest / the permanent / the unique / the most modern, or similar terms). The use of titles such as (the legend / celebrity expert, or similar titles) is also prohibited.

## Article Ten

Applications for the licenses referred to in this Decision shall be submitted to the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

## Article Eleven

The advertiser shall be obligated to include the advertising license number and the license of the pharmaceutical center or retail outlet clearly in all advertisements they publish.

## Article Twelve

The advertiser shall be obligated to provide correct and non-misleading health, medical, and pharmaceutical information to the recipient, based on the principles and standards approved by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs <orig>إدارة تسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنباتية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

## Article Thirteen

A register shall be established at the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, in which platforms of websites, electronic applications, and social media sites are listed, whether through the approved accounts of pharmaceutical centers or retail outlets, or accounts designated for commercial advertisements or display platforms, or the accounts of social media influencers, or other accounts belonging to practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, or other accounts on social media sites. Advertising shall not be permitted except after obtaining approval from the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig>.

## Article Fourteen

One account shall be created for each pharmaceutical center or retail outlet on each social media site, provided that it is issued in the name of the pharmaceutical center or retail outlet as stated in its license. The account must include the address of the center or outlet, its license number, its telephone numbers, and other means of contacting it.

## Article Fifteen

The Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> shall form a committee chaired by the Assistant Undersecretary for Pharmaceutical and Food Control Affairs <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد لشؤون الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig>. This committee shall be responsible for reviewing the applications submitted to the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> for the issuance of marketing or promotional advertising licenses for pharmaceutical centers and the practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions therein, and for retail outlets, or for the sale of medicines and products referred to in Article Two of this Decision.

## Article Sixteen

The committee referred to in Article Fifteen of this Decision shall decide on the advertising applications submitted to it after verifying that they meet the advertising conditions in accordance with the provisions of the laws, executive regulations, and ministerial decisions referred to in this Decision.

## Article Seventeen

The committee referred to in Article Fifteen of this Decision shall be responsible for canceling advertising licenses that violate the provisions of the laws referred to in this Decision.

# Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>
## Resolution No. (891/2024)
### Regarding Direct Connection to Landing Stations for the Data Center
### The Board of Directors
- Having reviewed Law No. (37) of 2014, establishing the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendments,
- And Decree No. (144) of 2022, forming the Board of Directors of the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>,
- And the esteemed Council of Ministers Resolution No. (993) of 2015, issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (37) of 2014, establishing the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>,
- And the recommendation of the Committee for Studying Connection with Landing Stations dated 9/5/2024,
- And the resolution of the Authority's Board of Directors taken in its meeting No. (12/2024) held on 25/11/2024,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.
## Has Decided
### Article One
The connection cost for each link of any capacity for cloud computing services for cloud zones designated by the Authority, which consist of three data centers belonging to a single licensee, shall be an amount of KWD 90 (ninety Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), in accordance with the regulation on the fee for the use of private state real estate properties allocated to the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>.
### Article Two
Internet service providers must provide data indicating the request from the cloud computing service provider at the data center, which consists of three data centers belonging to a single licensee designated by the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> located in the State of Kuwait.
### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance, and any provision that contradicts it shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

### Article Eighteen
Without prejudice to any more severe penalty stipulated in other laws, the provisions concerning crimes, penalties, and administrative procedures mentioned in Article 14 and Article 15 of Law No. 28 of 1996 regarding the regulation of the pharmacy profession and the circulation of medicines, as amended by Law No. 30 of 2016 and their executive regulations, and Article 73 of Law No. 70 of 2020 regarding the practice of the medical profession and its ancillary professions, patients' rights, and health facilities, shall apply to any violator of the provisions of this resolution.
### Article Nineteen
The provisions of this resolution shall not apply to advertisements published by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and pharmacies affiliated with other government entities. In the event that such entities publish violating advertisements, the Drug Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical and Food Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> shall take the necessary measures.
### Article Twenty
The provisions of this resolution shall apply to practitioners of the pharmacy profession and its ancillary professions, to the pharmaceutical center and points of sale, and to their license holders and managers.
### Article Twenty-One
This resolution shall be communicated to whom it may concern for its implementation. It shall be effective from its date, and any resolution or text that contradicts its provisions shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Decision No. P.A.I. (142) of 2024
## Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Decision No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A3-141), issued on 8/10/2024, which states that Al-Khatib Industries Company (Fadhel Aqab Al-Khatib and Partner) <orig>شركة صناعات الخطيب (فضل عقاب الخطيب وشريكه)</orig> committed the following violation:
    *   Leasing the industrial establishment or craft to a third party.
*   The report from the Industrial Inspection Department dated 5/11/2024, stating that the violation is still ongoing.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (492/2024/11) held on 2/12/2024.
*   And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
*   And in the public interest.

Has decided

(Article One)
To close Plot <orig>القسيمة</orig> No. (235) located in the Subhan Industrial Area <orig>منطقة صبحان الصناعية</orig> - Block (11), belonging to Messrs. / Al-Khatib Industries Company (Fadhel Aqab Al-Khatib and Partner) <orig>شركة صناعات الخطيب (فضل عقاب الخطيب وشريكه)</orig>, until the violations and their resulting effects are rectified.

(Article Two)
In the event the violation is not rectified within (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

(Article Three)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

Issued on: 30 December 2024 G

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Decision No. P.A.I. (132) of 2024
### Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Decision No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A2-156), issued on 24/9/2024, which states that Istidama International General Trading Company <orig>شركة استدامة العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig> committed the following violations:
    *   Unlicensed workers' accommodation (workers' housing of 8 rooms).
    *   Encroachment on state property (placing counters outside the plot boundaries with an area of approximately 200 m²).
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (492/2024/11) held on 2/12/2024.
*   And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
*   And in the public interest.

Has decided

(Article One)
To warn Istidama International General Trading Company <orig>شركة استدامة العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig> - located in the Amghara Industrial Area <orig>منطقة أمغرة الصناعية</orig> - Block (4) - Plot (243) - of the necessity to rectify the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (one month). In the event the violation is not rectified, more severe measures will be taken in accordance with the regulations in force in this regard.

(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

## Article One
For the application of the provisions of this regulation, the following terms shall have the meanings
indicated next to each:
- The Law: Law No. 112 of 2013 <orig>قانون رقم 112 لسنة 2013</orig> establishing the Public Authority for Food
and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>.
- The Concerned Body: The Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>.
- The Competent Organizational Unit: The Department of Financial Affairs <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig>, Warehouses and Custody Section <orig>قسم المخازن والعهد</orig>.
- Archives: Any material bearing data or information, whether readable, audible,
or visible, held by the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>, which shall be retained for the periods
specified below. For matters not stipulated in the tables included in this decision,
the period mentioned in the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. 7 of 2001 shall be applied when
calculating the retention period.

## Article Two
The disposal by destruction of all archives under the supervision of the Public
Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> shall be carried out by the Warehouses and Custody Section <orig>قسم المخازن والعهد</orig> of the Department of Financial Affairs
<orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> after the expiration of the retention periods prescribed in the tables shown above and those listed
in the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. 7 of 2001 concerning the
Archives Regulation <orig>لائحة المحفوظات</orig>. This shall be done in coordination with the concerned departments of the Authority before
disposing of any archives whose retention period does not exceed five
years, to verify that none are related to any pending judicial dispute before the
Kuwaiti Courts <orig>المحاكم الكويتية</orig>.

## Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into force
from its date of issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig>
## Administrative Decision
### No. KPA/A/2-2025
The Director General of the Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig>
- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. (133) of 1977 establishing the Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig> and its amendments,
- And the Decree issued on 22/9/1980 regarding the internal regulations of the Authority and its amendments,
- And Ministerial Decision No. KPA/A/147-2001 regarding the issuance of the handling regulations in force at the Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig> and its amendments,
- And Article (2) of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision, which stipulates that the Director General of the Authority shall issue the necessary decisions for its implementation,
- And the approval of the Handling and Logistics Committee, formed by Administrative Decision No. KPA/A/451-2024, to renew the registration of handling companies accredited by the Authority for the year 2025, pursuant to its letter No. KPA/74/19/2024 dated 19/11/2024,
- And the approval of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> in its letter No. 5325/88/1/5/189 dated November 3, 2024, to renew the registration of handling companies accredited by the Authority for the period from 1/1/2025 to 31/12/2025.
- And in accordance with the public interest.

Has decided

### Article One
To renew the registration of the following companies as accredited handling contractors at Shuwaikh Port <orig>ميناء الشويخ</orig> for the period from 1/1/2025 to 31/12/2025:
1.  M/s GTC Logistic for Transport and Handling Company <orig>شركة جي تي سي لوجستيك للنقليات والمناولة</orig>:
    -   General cargo handling contractors.
    -   Container handling contractors.
2.  M/s Cargo Transport Systems Company <orig>شركة أنظمة نقل البضائع</orig>:
    -   General cargo handling contractors.
    -   Container handling contractors.

### Article Two
To renew the registration of the following companies as accredited handling contractors at Shuaiba Port <orig>ميناء الشعيبة</orig> for the period from 1/1/2025 to 31/12/2025:
1.  M/s GTC Logistic for Transport and Handling Company <orig>شركة جي تي سي لوجستيك للنقليات والمناولة</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).
2.  M/s Global Clearinghouse Systems Company <orig>شركة جلوبال كليرينج هاوس ستمر</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).
3.  M/s Cargo Transport Systems Company <orig>شركة أنظمة نقل البضائع</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).
4.  M/s Al-Hoss Engineering and Transport Company <orig>شركة الحص للهندسة والنقليات</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).
5.  M/s Integrated Logistics Company <orig>الشركة المتكاملة اللوجستية</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).

### Article Three
To renew the registration of the following company as an accredited handling contractor at Doha Port <orig>ميناء الدوحة</orig> for the period from 1/1/2025 to 31/12/2025:
- M/s Al-Abdali Joint Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة العبدلي المشتركة</orig> (General cargo handling contractors).

### Article Four
The registered company shall comply with all conditions included in Ministerial Decision No. KPA/A/147-2001 regarding the issuance of the handling regulations in force at the Kuwait Ports Authority <orig>مؤسسة الموانئ الكويتية</orig> and its amendments, any other amendments made to it by the Authority, and all other systems and regulations in force at the Authority.

### Article Five
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and shall be effective as of 1/1/2025. The concerned authorities shall, each within its jurisdiction, take the necessary measures for its implementation.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks Department of the High Court <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale by public auction of the property described below on Wednesday, 29/1/2025, in Hall 48, Second Floor, at the Justice Palace <orig>قصر العدل</orig>, at nine o'clock in the morning. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 433/2023 Sales /2.

## Filed by:
Khaled Athib Kayad Al-Dhafiri <orig>خالد عذيب كياد الظفيري</orig>.

## Against: First: Ahmed Athib Kayad Al-Dhafiri <orig>أحمد عذيب كياد الظفيري</orig>.
## Second: Thikrayat Mustafa Abbas Al-Ahmad <orig>ذكريات مصطفى عباس الأحمد</orig>, in her capacity as guardian of her two minor daughters, heirs of the late Dawas Hindi Al-Ajmi <orig>دواس هندي العجمي</orig>, namely:
1.  Noura Dawas Hindi Al-Ajmi <orig>نورا دواس هندي العجمي</orig>.
2.  Munira Dawas Hindi Al-Ajmi <orig>منيرة دواس هندي العجمي</orig>.

## Third: Latifa Hindi Rakan Al-Ajmi <orig>لطيفة هندي راكان العجمي</orig>.
## Fourth: Ahmed Hindi Rakan Al-Ajmi <orig>أحمد هندي راكان العجمي</orig>.
## Fifth: Iltifat Athib Kayad Al-Dhafiri <orig>التفات عذيب كياد الظفيري</orig>.
## Sixth: The Public Authority for Minors' Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون القصر</orig>, in its capacity as administrator of the affairs of the heirs of the late Jassim Athib Al-Dhafiri <orig>جاسم عذيب الظفيري</orig>, namely:
1.  Amira Jassim Athib Al-Dhafiri <orig>أميرة جاسم عذيب الظفيري</orig>.
2.  Al-Dana Jassim Athib Al-Dhafiri <orig>الدانه جاسم عذيب الظفيري</orig>.
3.  Amal Jassim Athib Al-Dhafiri <orig>أمل جاسم عذيب الظفيري</orig>.
4.  Al-Shaikha Jassim Athib Al-Dhafiri <orig>الشيخة جاسم عذيب الظفيري</orig>.

## Seventh: Nuwair Athib Kayad Al-Dhafiri <orig>نوير عذيب كياد الظفيري</orig> – Joined Party –
## Eighth: Nawal Mohammed Obeid Saad <orig>نوال محمد عبيد سعد</orig> – Intervening Party.

## Property Description:
-   The property under Title Deed No. 6551/1976, located in the Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> area – Plot No. 65 – Block No. 2 – Plan M/26935, with an area of 600 m², will be sold by public auction with a base price of 387,000 K.D., three hundred eighty-seven thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
-   And according to what is stated in the description certificate.
    The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + roof, and it conforms to License 491/80.
    The plaintiff's property located in the Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> area – Block (2) – Street (107) – Avenue (9) – House (47), was inspected on-site in preparation for its valuation in the presence of the plaintiff in person, the first defendant in person, and his agent, while the remaining defendants failed to attend or be legally represented. With the assistance of Mr. Abdulrahman Al-Habib <orig>عبد الرحمن الحبيب</orig>, an expert from the Valuation Experts Section <orig>قسم خبراء الدرابة</orig> of the General Directorate of Experts <orig>الإدارة العامة للخبراء</orig>, the inspection was conducted as follows:
-   **The property in dispute is a government house that conforms in its general and specific specifications to Title Deed No. (6551/1976) and has an area of (600 m²). The property overlooks two streets, has 3 entrances, and is bordered by neighbors on only two sides.**
-   **The property in dispute consists of a ground floor, a first floor, a second floor, and a yard, detailed as follows:**

## Second: Auction Conditions:

First: The auction shall start at a base price of 220,000 KWD (Two hundred and twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of this price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law.

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance announces the public auction of the property described below, to be held on Thursday, 13/2/2025, in Hall 52 on the second floor of the Justice Palace at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 614/2023 Sales/3.

Filed by:
Fatima Mohammed Al-Shar <orig>فاطمة محمد الشر</orig>, on her own behalf and in her capacity as guardian of her minor children (Amira <orig>أميرة</orig>, Zubaida <orig>زبيدة</orig>, Balqis <orig>بلقيس</orig>, Abdulredha <orig>عبدالرضا</orig>)

Against:
1- Ismail Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>إسماعيل عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
2- Khadija Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>خديجة عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
3- Laila Hussein Abdullah Abbas <orig>ليلي حسين عبدالله عباس</orig>.
4- Ali Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>علي عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
5- Fatima Sulaiman Mohammed Al-Sabt <orig>فاطمة سليمان محمد السبت</orig>.
6- Mahdi Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>مهدي عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
7- Abbas Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>عباس عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
8- Hassan Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>حسن عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
9- Ruqayyah Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>رقية عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
10- Narjis Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>نرجس عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
11- Mona Abdulmajeed Abbas Shihab <orig>منى عبدالمجيد عباس شهاب</orig>.
12- Director General of the Public Authority for Minors' Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون القصر</orig>, in his capacity.
13- The Legal Representative of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, in his capacity.

First: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance shall bear no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property under Title Deed No. (9584/1999), located in Rumaithiya <orig>الرميثية</orig> – Block No. (4), Plot No. (240) of Plan No. (M/27417), with an area of (400 m²).

Note: There is a violation consisting of two rooms made of light materials on the roof + one room with a roof of light materials in the property's yard, according to the Municipality's letter.

*Inspection:
A residential plot consisting of two and a half floors, located on a corner lot with three street frontages. The exterior cladding is white stone, and the property's air conditioning consists of separate units.
- Those present at the session were guided through the components of the disputed property, which are as follows:
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya with its bathroom, two living rooms, two bedrooms, a kitchen, a storage room, and two bathrooms.
- The first floor consists of a living room, 6 bedrooms, and 3 bathrooms.

2- The ground floor consists of a hall and a salon + a bathroom + a refrigerator storage room + a main kitchen + a driver's room with a bathroom in the yard and a diwaniya with a bathroom.
- Half of the second floor consists of 3 rooms and a bathroom, and the other half is a roof terrace.
- The condition of the property and building is old.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price of KWD 526,500 (Five hundred twenty-six thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price is required, payable by a certified check <orig>شيك مصدق</orig> from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee <orig>خطاب ضمان</orig> from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.

Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, plus expenses and registration fees, during the sale session <orig>جلسة البيع</orig>.

Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award <orig>رسو المزاد</orig> will be adjudicated to them, unless another person comes forward in that session offering to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the execution procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the official gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment <orig>حكم رسو المزاد</orig> is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to execute a lease contract in their favor at the prevailing market rent."

**** Property Description:
- The property of Document No. 182/2006, located in the Al-Shuhada area – Plot No. 288 – Block No. 1 – Plan M/37310 B, with an area of 400 m², to be sold by public auction with a base price of 534,600 KWD.

There is a violation, which is the construction of light materials on the roof with an area of 12 m².
** In accordance with the expert's report
Regarding the disputed property located in the Al-Shuhada area – Block 1 – Street 108 – House 48 – with an area of 400 m², according to Document No. 2 from the file of documents submitted by the fourth defendant in the session of (15/3/2022) – Automated No. (15970114), the inspection was conducted as follows:
- a. The disputed property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof.
- b. The property has a Sigma facade and overlooks two streets, an internal one and a main one.
- c. The property includes parking for four cars on the side of the internal street.
- d. The study expert obtained the necessary information to estimate the value of the property.
2. Regarding the division of the property, the expert was unable to divide the property as the plaintiff was not enabled to do so because the first defendant (currently occupying the property) prevented the expert from entering the disputed property to divide it. Accordingly, the study expert was consulted to estimate its value.
3. He estimated it at an amount of 660,000 KWD (six hundred and sixty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) in accordance with prevailing prices.
4. The plaintiff's share of the disputed property = 660,000 KWD * 8.333334% = 55,000.004 KWD (fifty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars and four fils), which is her mother's entire share.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated in the decision. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall be reopened at his own risk in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his own risk based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the price of the property.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 KWD, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
- 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
- 2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
- 3- The text of the last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draft a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

Property Description: (According to the attached Description Certificate)
The property of Document No. 8905/1992, located in the Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area – Plot No. 301 – Block No. 6 – from Plan No. M/27029 – with an area of 400 m2. To be sold at public auction with a base price of (KWD 280,000) (Two hundred and eighty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to what is stated in the Description Certificate:
The property is located within a private residential area and consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a portion of the roof.
** According to what is stated in the Expert's Report
Inspection:
On 27/10/2020, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area – Block 6 – Street 10 – House 301, in the presence and under the guidance of the male and female representatives of the plaintiffs, the female representative of the third plaintiff, and the second defendant in person, Mr. Mutlaq Farah Al-Ajmi <orig>مطلق فرح العجمي</orig>, and in the presence of the study expert, Mr. Khalid Al-Harbawi <orig>خالد الحربوي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is an old house consisting of two floors and an annex, with an exterior stone cladding. It is located on a corner of two streets with a setback.
- The door was knocked, and a housemaid came out, but she did not allow us to enter.
- The expert was unable to inspect the property from the inside, and the property will be valued from the outside.
- The expert found that the area of the property, according to the document, is 400 m2.
- The study expert inspected the property and took all his notes on it in preparation for estimating the value of the disputed property.
## Second: Auction Conditions:
### First:
The auction shall begin at the base price associated with the property. To participate in the auction, it is required to pay at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
### Second:
The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
### Third:
If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at his liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
### Fourth:
If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be ruled in his favor. However, if another person comes forward in this session to purchase the property with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price, then in this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this price.
### Fifth:
If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at his liability on the basis of the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price,
and the legal fees, expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draft a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."
President of the Court of First Instance <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

# Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig>
## Announcement

Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> announces the following auction:

<table_caption>Kuwait University Tender for Banking Services</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Amount | Closing Date | Preliminary Meeting | Initial Bid Bond Percentage | Specifications |
|:--|:--------|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | 1000 K.D. | 18/2/2025 | 2/2/2025 at 10:30 AM at the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> | 2% of the total bid value | Auction No. 2024-2025/7 for the utilization and management of the site in the Administrative Building – Ground Floor at Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig> as a bank branch to provide banking services – for a period of 10 years |
</table>

Auction documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, 03/11/2024, and on the following days during official working hours from the Procurement Department's <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> website: https://pur.ku.edu.kw. The complete bid, sealed with the company's stamp, must be submitted on three (3) CDs no later than 12:00 PM on Tuesday, 18/2/2025. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered. The bids will be opened in a public session, taking into account the submission of the following:

- The original bid and undertaking form.
- An initial bid bond of 2% of the bid value.
- The original, stamped price quotation.
- A copy of a valid certificate of national labor percentage.
- The envelope designated for the auction.
- The purchase receipt from the website.
- The documents requested by the University in the auction documents.
- Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) accredited by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> must provide proof of such accreditation.

The bid will be disqualified if the required documents are not attached.
Bids are to be placed in the designated tender box at the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> in Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig> (Al-Shadadiya), University Administration Building – Sixth Floor – Supplier Affairs Section <orig>قسم شؤون الموردين</orig>.

Note:
- The auction documents may be collected by companies specialized in this field, provided they are registered with the Supplier Affairs Section <orig>قسم شؤون الموردين</orig> at Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig>, from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM.

# Competition Protection Authority <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>
## Correction
A typographical error occurred in Issue 1721, published on 12/1/2025 AD, where the company name was incorrectly stated as / Al-Bakrawi Holding LPD <orig>البكراوي القابضة إل بي دي</orig> (United Arab Emirates). The correct name is / Energy House Holding Company (Public Shareholding Company) <orig>بيت الطاقة القابضة (شركة مساهمة)</orig> (Kuwait).
Therefore, we are republishing the announcement after correcting the error.

Requesting approval to complete the economic concentration transaction:
The acquisition by Bait Al-Emaar Al-Khaleeji Company (One Person Company) <orig>شركة بيت الإعمار الخليجي (شركة الشخص الواحد)</orig> of 54.84% of the capital of Energy House Holding Company (Public Shareholding Company) <orig>شركة بيت الطاقة القابضة (شركة مساهمة)</orig>.
In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 concerning the Protection of Competition and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Decision No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulates that "any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Authority regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication...".
Accordingly, the Authority invites any interested party to submit its reasoned objection to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.
The data related to objections shall be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Authority <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, 14th floor, by filling out the form available on the website, along with payment of the prescribed fee.

# Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>

Announcement Regarding the List of Companies Invited to Participate in Limited Tender No.: RFP-2133633

The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation and its Subsidiaries <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا لمناقصات مؤسسة البترول الكويتية وشركائها التابعة</orig>, at the request of Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>, announces the list of companies invited to participate in the limited tender:
No.: RFP-2133633
**CONSULTANCY SERVICES TO REVIEW AND ENHANCE SECURITY SYSTEMS OF OIL FIELD CHECKPOINTS, PERIMETERS AND HIGH RISK ASSETS**

In this regard, we draw attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16) of the Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 <orig>قانون المناقصات رقم (49) لسنة 2016</orig>, the aforementioned tender will be offered to the following list of (4) companies at least (30) days after the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and on the company's website. Any interested party whose name is not on the list of companies invited to the tender has the right to file a grievance, request to be excluded, or submit a request to participate in the tender, supported by relevant documents and addressed to Mr. / Chairman of the Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation and its Subsidiaries <orig>السيد / رئيس لجنة الشراء العليا لمناقصات مؤسسة البترول الكويتية وشركائها التابعة</orig>, within (30) days from the date of this announcement:

1.  Tender documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, 19/1/2025, and on the following days, during official working hours from the Tenders Section at the Financial Affairs Department - 6th Floor, Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig> building in the Al-Riggai <orig>الرقعي</orig> area.
2.  The deadline for submitting bids is 12:00 PM on Tuesday, 2/2/2025. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered.
3.  Bids must be submitted to the Tenders Section accompanied by a preliminary bid bond for the total items bid upon, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee approved by a local bank in the State of Kuwait. The submitted bond must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity (90 days).
4.  Any bid not accompanied by a certified preliminary bid bond, or if the bond's value or duration is less than required, will be disqualified.
5.  All documents must be submitted on a copyable CD, except for the bid form and the preliminary bid bond form, which must be submitted as hard copies.
6.  The public meeting for the opening of envelopes will be held on Sunday, 2/2/2025, at 2:00 PM in the meeting hall attached to the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for the Administrative and Financial Affairs Sector on the 6th floor.
7.  All companies participating in the tender are invited to attend the opening of envelopes at the time and place specified above.

Notes:
- The tender documents may be collected by companies specialized in this field, provided they are registered with the Tenders Section at the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig>, from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM, upon presentation of the registration card for the year 2024/2025.

Announcement
### Tender for Practice No. (16-2024/2025)
Regarding the renewal of licenses for the integrated service system for people of determination, the deaf, and the mute at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (16-2024/2025) for the benefit of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the statements and lists of the practice documents available at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry. These can be obtained from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry - Financial Affairs Department – Procurement and Warehouses Control – Tenders and Contracts Section – Financial Affairs Department – Procurement and Warehouses Control – Tenders and Contracts Section – Ministries Complex, Block No. (1), Third Floor, Room No. (1307), for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, per copy, payable via K-NET during official working hours, starting from noon on Sunday, 19/1/2025. The deadline for submitting bids is 12:00 PM on Monday, 3/2/2025. Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement and Warehouses Control. These bids shall be valid for a period of ninety days from the date of unsealing the envelopes, and the submitted price shall be final. The value of the initial bid bond for this tender shall be no less than (2%) of the bid value and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Thursday, 9/1/2025, at 10:15 AM, at the company's headquarters located in the North Subhan <orig>صبحان الشمالي</orig> area next to the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>, the Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Ahliya United General Services Company <orig>شركة الأهلية المتحدة للخدمات العامة</orig> (K.S.C.C) was held to discuss its agenda. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Khalil Abdul Redha Najaf Ameer <orig>خليل عبد الرضا نجف أمير</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, and was attended by:
First: Shareholders representing 20,000,000 shares (by proxy and in person), with an attendance rate of 100.000% of the company's total shares of 20,000,000.
Second: The attendance of Mr. Omar Osama Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر أسامة الزواوي</orig> – representative of the Gulf Company for Securities Custody <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
After the legal quorum for the meeting was declared complete with an attendance rate of 100.000%, the items on the agenda were considered as follows:
Item One: Approval to amend Article No. (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article No. (4) of the company's Articles of Association to read as shown below:
- Text before amendment:
1- Road cleaning contracting – International Activity Code 812907.
2- Collection of materials for recycling – International Activity Code 381103.
3- Collection of hazardous waste – International Activity Code 381200.
4- Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste – International Activity Code 382100.
5- Landscaping and maintenance of gardens – International Activity Code 813012.
6- General cleaning, industrial cleaning, and maintenance services for buildings – International Activity Code 812110.
7- General cleaning services for buildings – International Activity Code 811002.
8- Manual and steam cleaning and ironing of clothes – International Activity Code 960115.
9- Testing and measurement of environmental indicators – International Activity Code 712040.
10- Transportation of liquid and solid waste – International Activity Code 492309.
11- Rental of passenger cars without a driver – International Activity Code 771010.

# For First Energy Resources Company "Under Liquidation"
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Sunday, December 29, 2024, at 11:30 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of the First Energy Resources Company "Under Liquidation" was held at the headquarters of First Investment Company (Sharq - Al Hamra Tower - 68th Floor).
After announcing that the legal quorum for the meeting was met, with the attendance of shareholders owning 156,880,230 shares, representing 72.462% of the company's shares, Mr. Mohammed Ghaith Mohammed Al-Tayyar <orig>محمد غيث محمد الطيار</orig> - Chairman of the General Assembly, opened the meeting with praise to God and prayers and peace upon the Messenger of God. The Assembly then began discussing the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly as follows:

- First Item: Extending the liquidation period for one year from the date of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting.
  The Extraordinary General Assembly approved the extension of the liquidation period for one year, effective from the date of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting on 29/12/2024.
- Second Item: Reappointing the Liquidation Committee.
  The Extraordinary General Assembly approved the reconstitution of the Liquidation Committee to consist of:
  - Mr. Abdulaziz Nasser Al-Saleh <orig>عبدالعزيز ناصر الصالح</orig>.
  The Extraordinary General Assembly also approved the calculation of an amount of KWD 2,000 annually as his fees for the liquidation period mentioned in the Commercial Register entry dated 06/01/2016.

Member of the Liquidation Committee

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of M.T.C. Holding K.S.C.C.
held its meeting on Saturday, 21/12/2024, at
eleven o'clock in the morning, in the main meeting hall
at the factory of the Industrial Company for Medical Products, located in Subhan
Industrial Area – Plot (10) – Block (59 : 66); in the presence of
the following:
Mr. Mohammed Abdulrahman Al-Turk <orig>محمد عبدالرحمن الترك</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors.
Mr. Khalid Muhalhal Al-Musaff <orig>خالد مهلهل المصف</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors
and minority shareholders.
Ms. Heba Fakhri Khamis <orig>هبه فخري خميس</orig>, Secretary.
After announcing that the legal quorum for the meeting was met, with an attendance
rate of 91.7% of the shareholders, of which 45.8% were in person and
45.9% by proxy, the meeting was opened and chaired by Mr. Mohammed Abdul
Rahman Al-Turk <orig>محمد عبد الرحمن الترك</orig> (Chairman of the Board of Directors). He welcomed the attendees and began discussing
all the items on the agenda, which were approved, and
the following resolutions were adopted:
Approval of reconciling the company's activities in accordance with international codes
by amending Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles
of Association as follows:
Articles before amendment:
"Without prejudice to the provisions of the Companies Law No. 25 of 2012
and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes
for which the company was established are:"
1- Managing subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies
in which it holds shares and providing the necessary support to them.
2- Investing its funds by trading in shares, bonds, and other
securities.
3- Owning real estate and movables necessary to conduct its business within the limits
permitted by law.
4- Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes
and guaranteeing them with third parties. In this case, the participation percentage of the
holding company in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
5- Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks,
or industrial models, franchises, and other intangible rights,
and exploiting and leasing them to subsidiary companies or others, whether
inside or outside Kuwait.
6- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by
investing them in portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
All or some of these purposes may be pursued.
Articles after amendment:
"Without prejudice to the provisions of the Companies Law, its amendments, and its executive
regulations, the purposes for which
the company was established are:"

Upon the invitation of Mr. Alex Gemici <orig>أليكس جيميسي</orig>, in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors of Greenstone Kuwait Investment Consulting Company K.S.C.C. <orig>شركة جرينستون الكويت للاستشارات الاستثمارية ش.م.ك.م</orig> (the "Company"), the Extraordinary General Assembly was held at 12:00 PM on November 18, 2024, at the Company's headquarters to consider the following agenda:
- Appointment of the new liquidator, Mr. Ali Mohammed Kohari <orig>علي محمد كوهري</orig>, following the death of Mr. Mohammed Hamad Sulaiman Al-Sultan <orig>محمد حمد سليمان السلطان</orig> and the approval of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

It was confirmed that the legal quorum was met for the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting.

At the beginning of the meeting, Mr. Alex Gemici <orig>أليكس جيميسي</orig>, the Chairman of the Assembly, proposed the appointment of Ms. Alison Fielder <orig>أليسون فيولدر</orig> as the Secretary and Vote Counter for the meeting. The Assembly unanimously approved this appointment. The Secretary and Vote Counter announced that the number of shares represented constitutes 99% of the Company's capital and that the necessary legal quorum was present, thus validating the meeting.

The Chairman of the Board opened the meeting by presenting the agenda, and after deliberation, the Extraordinary General Assembly issued the following resolutions:

1.  Approval of the appointment of a liquidator for the Company in place of the previous liquidator, with the following details:

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Sherman's Club Kuwait Company <orig>شركة شيرمانز كلوب الكويت</orig> K.S.C. (Closed) held its extraordinary meeting at 11:00 AM on Wednesday, 25/12/2024, at the company's headquarters located in Sharq – Kiko Tower – 54th Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Adel Jassem Al-Ruqayan <orig>عادل جاسم الروقيان</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was also attended by:
- Shareholders holding 2,500,000 shares by proxy, representing 100% of the company's total capital of 250,000 Kuwaiti Dinars.
After announcing the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, a number of minority shareholders, according to the attendance proxies, holding four hundred shares representing 0.016% of the paid-up capital, authorized Mr. Farouq Taha Abdullatif Al-Oumi <orig>فاروق طه عبداللطيف العومي</orig> to vote on their behalf on the agenda items.
The Chairman of the session opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, after which the company's Extraordinary General Assembly discussed the agenda and made the following decisions:
1- Increase the company's authorized capital, where approval was granted to increase the company's authorized capital from KWD 250,000 (only two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 1,000,000, divided into 10,000,000 shares (ten million shares), with a value of (100) Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are cash shares. This is by increasing the authorized capital by KWD 750,000 (seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) and authorizing the Board of Directors to call for the increase of the issued and paid-up capital, to register the increase of the issued and paid-up capital in the Commercial Register, and to determine the terms and conditions in full or in part, in one or more installments, within the limits of the authorized capital, by a decision from it specifying the amount, methods, and type of the increase, its call date(s), and all its terms and provisions. The Ordinary General Assembly authorizes the Board of Directors to decide on the issuance premium and determine its value to be added to the nominal value of the additional shares, and to dispose of any share fractions, if any. The Board of Directors is authorized to set the dates for the subscription periods, and the company's shareholders shall have priority right to subscribe to the cash increase, each according to their share in the company's capital, for a period of not less than 15 days from the date of opening the subscription. - The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 06/02/2025. Bids submitted after this deadline will not be considered.
- Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Tenders and Contracts Section at the above address in a sealed envelope containing two (2) identical, matching, protected, and non-modifiable compact discs (CDs). Each CD must contain all financial and technical documents for the practice, signed and stamped with the practitioner's seal, along with two (2) hard copies of the declaration and undertaking form and the bid form.
- A preliminary guarantee of (2%) of the bid value must be submitted in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee approved by a local bank in the State of Kuwait. The submitted guarantee must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, which is (90) days. (Any bid not accompanied by a preliminary guarantee will be excluded).
- A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> for the year 2025 and valid for one year, must be submitted upon purchasing the practice documents and submitting the bid.
- An authorization letter from the company to purchase the practice documents.
- The fee for purchasing the aforementioned practice documents is non-refundable.
- A preliminary meeting for all practitioners will be held on Sunday, 02/02/2025, at 11:00 AM. Any practitioner with inquiries regarding the practice must attend in person or send a representative. In the event of the practitioner's or their representative's absence, they will be considered to have agreed to all procedures and discussions that took place during the preliminary meeting. (Details are in the practice document).
- Envelopes will be opened on Sunday, 09/02/2025, at 2:00 PM in a public session at the Ministry, 13th floor, office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Administrative and Financial Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون الإدارية والمالية</orig>. Company representatives are required to present an authorization letter from their company to attend the envelope-opening committee.

Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:
1- The applying company must be registered in the supplier registry with the Medical Warehouses Department.
2- The applying company must specialize in the medical field, documented by a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
3- When submitting two offers, two separate tender booklets must be purchased with two different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and substance's registration in the supplier registry at the Medical Warehouses Department, within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to drug control).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether it is a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for the relevant control (medicines – medical supplies).
6- Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.
7- Tender documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's website.
8- The fee for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the tender documents.
9- Price quotations must be submitted in a sealed envelope, inclusive of the tender documents, by the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's website.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee, Session No. 44/2024, held on 29/12/2024

After reviewing the applications submitted to amend data in the births and deaths registries, it was decided to make the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee receives no objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the registries, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee, held on 29/12/2024

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, convened.
*   Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths - Chairman
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Department - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Registration Department - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department - Member
*   Mr. / Legal Researcher - Member

The committee's secretarial duties were performed by Mrs. / Aliaa Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.
The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((811)) to No. ((823)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the births and deaths registries for late registration of birth and death requests. After examination and verification of the completion of documents and records, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement expires without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and the birth and death certificates will be issued.

## Announcement Record of Sale of Seized Items

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Enforcement Directorate <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> – Compulsory Enforcement Department <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – announces that on Wednesday, 5/2/2025, starting at 10:30 AM, a public auction will be held for the sale of the movables of the judgment debtor / Faisal Abdullah Al-Faris <orig>فيصل عبدالله الفارس</orig> – the factory located in Amrah – Plot 3 – Parcel 258 – Automated Address No. (94346458), as detailed in the seizure report dated 12/7/2023, which became enforceable under mortgage contract No. 310/Volume 3. The company shall have a legal personality from the date of its registration, and it may not commence its activities until the date of its registration and after obtaining the approval of all regulatory authorities to conduct its business.

### Article (3)
The name of the company is: Al-Dana International Real Estate Company (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company) <orig>شركة الدانة الدولية العقارية (شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة)</orig> and its trade name is State of Kuwait.

### Article (4)
The company's head office is located in the State of Kuwait, and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait. The Board of Directors may move the head office to any other location within the State of Kuwait and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait. The company's headquarters is considered its legal domicile, which shall be used for sending correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its details shall be recorded in the Commercial Register. Any change to this headquarters shall not be effective until it is recorded in the Commercial Register.

### Article (5)
The duration of this company is unlimited and begins from the date of (registration).

### Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its executive regulations, and its amendments, the purposes for which the company was established are as follows:
- 1- Buying and selling land and real estate.
- 2- Managing and leasing owned or leased real estate.
- 3- Managing and leasing owned or leased real estate (non-residential).
- 4- Managing and developing land and real estate.
- 5- Buying and selling products.
- 6- Managing and operating hotels.
- 7- Owning real estate and movables for the benefit of the company.
- 8- Managing properties for others.
The company may conduct these activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or through an agency.
It may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its aforementioned purposes.

And they, being of full legal capacity, have requested the notarization of the following contract:

Legal Form: Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company

Preamble
Articles of Incorporation

### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through a public offering as set forth in Article 160 of the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its amendments, and its Executive Regulations.
### Article (11)
A shareholder's right to dispose of their shares shall be restricted by the following two conditions:
1. A pre-emptive right for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2. The requirement of the Board of Directors' approval of the share purchaser.
The transactions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law are exempted from these two restrictions.
### Article (12)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of the sale. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have passed from the date of notification without any shareholder submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, it must be done at the price stated in the terms of the sale.
### Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions concerning the company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors rejects the purchaser, it must purchase the shares for the company's account within ten days from the date the Board was notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price at which the shareholder had agreed to sell their shares.

The company's shares are nominal. Non-Kuwaitis (may not) own them except in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating this.
### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been paid in full. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a resolution of the company's Board of Directors, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.

The resolution to increase the capital must include the amount and methods of the increase.
