Article (15)
Ownership of a share automatically entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Memorandum of Association, the provisions of the company's Articles of Association, and the resolutions of its General Assembly.

Article (16)
Each share entitles its holder to a share equal to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

Article (17)
The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency, in which the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, their domiciles, the number of shares owned by each, their type, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded. Any changes to the registered data shall be noted in the shareholders' register in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency to provide them with data from this register.

Article (18)
The Constituent Assembly
Within three months from the date of the completion of the subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement with the number of shares they have subscribed to, the value of the subscribers' payment of the due installments, the names and addresses of the subscribers, the number of shares subscribed to by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

Article (19)
The founders must call the Constituent Assembly to convene within three months from the date of the completion of the subscription. If this period elapses without the Assembly being convened, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of the expiry of the said period, call the Constituent Assembly to convene.

Article (20)
The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the agenda and the time and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement being published after a period of not less than seven days from the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand-delivery of the invitation to the shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting date, with an acknowledgment of receipt noted on a copy of the invitation.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations of the Companies Law.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda and the time and place of the meeting at least seven days before it is held, so that its representative may attend.
The Constituent Assembly meeting shall be chaired by a person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

Article (21)
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders entitled to vote who represent more than half of the number of subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of not less than seven days and not more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees. A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be passed by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

Article 22
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation procedures and the amounts spent, along with the supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location specified by the founders for the subscribers to review at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be mentioned in the invitation to the subscribers to attend the meeting.

Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly is responsible for the following matters:
1- Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and compliance with the provisions of the Companies Law and the company's contract.
2- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
3- Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
4- Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the resolutions passed, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors must publish the company's contract and register it in the Commercial Register within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
Article (24)
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares that are decided to be distributed.
2- Participating in the management of the company through membership on the Board of Directors, attending General Assemblies, and taking part in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law and these Articles of Association. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the

3. Implementation of the resolutions issued by the General Assembly of Shareholders.
4. Refraining from any act that leads to harming the financial or moral interests of the company and committing to compensate for damages arising from the violation thereof.

## Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders may not do the following:
1- Increase the shareholder's financial burdens or increase the nominal value of the share.
2- Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to the shareholders as specified in the company's contract.
3- Impose new conditions other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles of Association regarding the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies.
These provisions may be departed from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote in which all shareholders participate, and upon fulfillment of the necessary procedures to amend the company's contract.

A- Board of Directors
Company Management

## Article (27)
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (four members) 4 members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.

## Article (28)
The shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's contract may stipulate the election of a number not exceeding half of the first Board of Directors from among the company's founders.

## Article (29)
The Board of Directors shall elect, by secret ballot, a Chairman of the Board and a Deputy Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to the other competencies specified in the contract. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relationship with third parties. He must implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Deputy Chairman shall replace the Chairman in his absence or if there is an impediment preventing him from exercising his competencies.

## Article (30)
The Board of Directors may carry out all acts required for the management of the company in accordance with its purposes. This authority is limited only by what is stipulated in the law, the company's contract, or the resolutions of the General Assembly. The Board of Directors may sell, purchase, and mortgage the company's real estate, borrow, enter into guarantees, arbitration, settlements, and donations.

## Article (31)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among the Board members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall determine his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

## Article (32)
The Board of Directors may distribute the work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to carry out one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies vested in the Board.

## Article (33)
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members chosen in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as the elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

## Article (34)
A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by at least half of the members, provided the number of attendees is not less than three. Meetings may be held using modern means of communication. Resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during a single year.

## Article (36)
If a position of a member of the Board of Directors becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the most votes among those who were not elected to the Board of Directors. If there is an impediment preventing them, they shall be succeeded by someone else. The new member shall only complete the term of their predecessor.
However, if the number of vacant positions reaches one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly of shareholders to convene within two months from the date the last position became vacant, to elect members to fill the vacant positions.

## Article (37)
A candidate for membership of the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1. To have the legal capacity to act.
2. Not to have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime against honor or integrity, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of this law, unless they have been rehabilitated.
3. To be a personal owner, or the person they represent to be an owner, of a number of the company's shares.
4. Any other conditions stated in the Articles of Association.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership status shall be revoked.

## Article (38)
Membership on the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article 234 of the Companies Law.
A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

## Article (39)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain a benefit for themselves or for others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their board membership, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law, the company's contract, or these bylaws.

## Article (40)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties any company secrets they have become aware of in the course of their management duties. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held liable for compensation for damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (41)
The chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members may not hold a board membership in two competing companies, nor participate in any work that would compete with the company, nor trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity in which the company is engaged. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to claim compensation from them or to consider the transactions they conducted for their own account as having been conducted for the company's account, unless this is approved by the Ordinary General Assembly.

## Article (42)
The total remuneration for the chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a dividend of not less than five percent of the capital to the shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual bonus not exceeding six thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> may be distributed to the chairman of the Board of Directors and to each member of this board from the date of the company's incorporation until profits are achieved that allow for the distribution of bonuses in accordance with the preceding paragraph. The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's Ordinary General Assembly for approval, which must include a precise and detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, whatever their nature or designation.

## Article (43)
It is not permissible for anyone who has a representative on the Board of Directors, or for the chairman, any member of the Board of Directors, any member of the executive management, or their spouses or second-degree relatives, to have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or for the account of the company, unless authorized by a license issued by the Ordinary General Assembly.

## Article (44)
The company may not grant a loan to a member of its Board of Directors, the Chief Executive Officer, their spouses, their relatives up to the second degree, or their subsidiary companies, unless there is an authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly. Any act in violation of this shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of a bona fide third party.

## Article (45)
The chairman and members of the Board of Directors are liable to the company, the shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, any violation of the law or the company's contract, and for mismanagement. A proposal by the General Assembly to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly resolutions related to discharging them from liability, or concluding agreements, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or concerning a dispute between them and the company.

when the dispute is decided by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law.

### Article (46)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for paying compensation, unless a group of them objected to the decision that gave rise to the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

### Article (47)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors for errors that result in damages to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake the filing of the lawsuit.

### Article (48)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to the lawsuit so that compensation may be awarded to it, if warranted. A shareholder may also file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them personal harm. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

### Article (49)
B – The General Assembly
The annual Ordinary General Assembly shall convene upon the invitation of the Board of Directors within the three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the General Assembly to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must call the Assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders holding ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the party calling for the meeting.
The procedures for calling the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting shall be subject to the provisions specific to the Constituent Assembly as stipulated in the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its Executive Regulations.

### Article (50)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of shares they hold, has the right to attend the General Assembly, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes assigned to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote, either for themselves or on behalf of those they represent, on matters related to a special interest for them, or in a dispute between them and the company. Any condition or resolution to the contrary shall be null and void. A shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization granted by the company for this purpose.
Anyone claiming a right to shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of summary matters to obtain an order on a petition to prohibit the disputed shares from voting for a period determined by the judge or

### Article (51)
The General Assembly meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors, their deputy, a person delegated by the Board of Directors for this purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

### Article (52)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly, in its annual meeting, is competent to adopt resolutions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, including, in particular, the following:
1.  The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and its financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2.  The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3.  A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities for which penalties have been imposed on the company.
4.  The company's financial statements.
5.  The Board of Directors' proposals regarding the distribution of profits.
6.  Discharging the members of the Board of Directors from liability.
7.  Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
8.  Appointing the company's auditor and determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9.  A report on transactions that have been or will be conducted with related parties. Related parties are defined in accordance with International Accounting Standards.

### Article (53)
By a resolution of the company's Ordinary General Assembly, the Chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new board elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders holding not less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors, and if a new board is not elected at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that the current board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary management committee whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly to elect the new board within one month of its appointment.

### Article (54)
The Ordinary General Assembly may not discuss topics not listed on the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or were discovered during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority, the auditor, or a number of shareholders holding five percent of the company's capital. If it becomes apparent during the discussion that the information regarding some of the matters presented is insufficient.

The meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding ten business days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued share capital. The postponed meeting shall be held without the need for new convocation procedures.

## Article (55)
The Board of Directors must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly, unless such resolutions are in violation of the law, the Memorandum of Association, or these Articles of Association.
The Board of Directors must resubmit the violating resolutions to the General Assembly in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (56)
The provisions relating to the Ordinary General Assembly shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (57)
The Extraordinary General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must call the Extraordinary General Assembly to convene within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors does not call the General Assembly to convene within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry shall call for the meeting within a period of fifteen days from the expiry date of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (58)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, a second meeting shall be called, which shall be valid if attended by shareholders representing more than half of the issued capital.
Resolutions shall be passed by a majority of more than half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (59)
Without prejudice to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly shall have jurisdiction over the following matters:
- 1. Amending the company's contract.
- 2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other manner.
- 3. Dissolving, merging, transforming, or dividing the company.
- 4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

## Article (60)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until after the completion of publication procedures.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

## Article (61)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit to nullify any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's Memorandum of Association, or these Articles of Association, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation where applicable.
It is also permissible to challenge the resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assembly that are prejudicial to the rights of the minority. The challenge may be made by a number of the company's shareholders who own fifteen percent of the company's issued capital and who did not approve of those resolutions.

## Article (62)
The company shall be liable—on a joint and several basis—for the debts of its subsidiary partners if the following conditions are met:
- 1- The subsidiary company's funds are insufficient to meet its obligations.
- 2- The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary's capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the board members and managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
- 3- The subsidiary company makes decisions or takes actions that serve the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and which are the primary cause of the subsidiary's inability to meet its obligations.
All of this applies unless the holding company is liable for the subsidiary's debts for another reason.

## Article (63)
The company's fiscal year begins on the first of January and ends on the 31st of December of each year, with the exception of the company's first fiscal year, which shall begin from the date of the company's registration in the Register and end on the 31st of December of the following fiscal year.

## Article (64)
A percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to secure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not permit the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve that allows for the distribution of this percentage of profits. Whatever is deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years permit, unless this reserve exceeds

**Article (65)**
A percentage shall be deducted annually from the gross profits, to be determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for any decrease in their value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or for their repair. These funds may not be distributed to the shareholders.

**Article (66)**
The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social security laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

**Article (67)**
A percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

**Article (68)**
The General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

**Article (69)**
Auditor
The provisions of the articles contained in the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, namely Articles 227 through 233, shall apply.

**Article (70)**
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for all its subsidiaries, supported by clarifications and data in accordance with the requirements of International Accounting Standards.

**Article (71)**
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved for any of the reasons stipulated in Articles 266 through 277 of the Companies Law and the articles of its executive regulations and their amendments.

**Article (72)**
The company shall be liquidated in the manner set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 through 295 of the Companies Law and the articles of its executive regulations and their amendments.

**Article (73)**
The provisions of the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters for which no special provision is made in the Memorandum of Association or in these Articles.

**Article (74)**
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file at the competent department of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. Any person wishing to obtain a true copy may request it from the company for a specific fee determined by the company.

**Article (75)**
The founders acknowledge the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and have deposited the amount of their value required by law in a local bank at the company's disposal.
Second: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies to manage the company.
Third: The papers and documents supporting the aforementioned declarations are kept with the official instrument.
In witness whereof, this contract was drawn up, and after being read to those present and signed, it was executed in one (1) original and one (1) copy, consisting of two (2) pages of this length of writing, with no deletions, additions, or attachments.

**Article (76)**
This contract is executed in one original and four copies, each copy consisting of one page, with the company's Articles of Association attached, which consists of four copies, each copy consisting of one page and containing a number of articles with no deletions or additions.
An original copy of the company's contract shall be kept at its head office and on its website.
An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file at the competent department of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. Anyone who wishes to obtain a true copy may request it from the company for a specific fee determined by the company.

K) Only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (payment via K-Net only) for the booklet, which is non-refundable. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon presentation of the relevant certificate). This is effective from Sunday, 19/01/2025, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into consideration the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 02/02/2025. No bids will be accepted after this deadline.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- A preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the entire duration of the bid, which is (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative for purchasing the bid document.
6- This bid is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The preliminary meeting and site inspection will be on Sunday, 26/01/2025, at 9:00 AM. The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for any duration it deems appropriate.

After reviewing the Constitution,
And Law No. 4 of 1962 concerning the exchange of letters, memoranda, and international agreements,
And the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019,
And after the approval of the National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

**Article One**

The Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019, attached to this decree <orig>مرسوم</orig>, has been approved.

**Article Two**

The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the ministers – each within his jurisdiction – shall implement this decree <orig>مرسوم</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Deputy Amir and Crown Prince**
**Nawaf Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>نواف الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Prime Minister**
**Sabah Khaled Al-Hamad Al-Sabah <orig>صباح خالد الحمد الصباح</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 2 Rajab 1442 H
Corresponding to: 14 February 2021 AD

***

**Law No. 4 of 2021**
**Approving the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq Concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>**

The National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig> has approved the following law, which we have ratified and promulgated:

**Article One**

The Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019, has been approved.

**Article Two**

The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the ministers – each within his jurisdiction – shall implement this law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>صباح الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 2 Rajab 1442 H
Corresponding to: 14 February 2021 AD

**Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>**
**Ministerial Decision No. 25 of 2021**
**Amending some provisions of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds**

**The Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,**

- After reviewing Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds and its amendments,
- And Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بالقانون</orig> No. 116 of 1992 concerning the administrative organization and defining the competencies and authorities of government bodies,
- And Decree <orig>مرسوم</orig> No. 190 of 2000 concerning the administrative organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- And the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds, issued by Ministerial Decision No. 109 of 1994 and its amendments,
- And based on the submission of the Undersecretary of the Ministry,

**Has decided:**

**Article One**

The text of Article (2) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds shall be replaced with the following text:
"The entities subject to the provisions of Law No. 1 of 1993 referred to above shall provide the Ministry with the following data and documents:
1. A copy of the company's articles of incorporation and its articles of association, and any amendments thereto.
2. The names of the members of the board of directors, their nationalities, and the dates of their appointment.
3. The names of the managers, their nationalities, and the dates of their appointment.
4. The names of the auditors and the date of their appointment.
5. The balance sheet and the profit and loss account for the ended fiscal year, and the board of directors' report on the company's activities and financial position, and the auditors' report, within one week from the date of their approval by the general assembly.
6. The minutes of the general assembly meetings, within one week from the date of the meeting.
7. The minutes of the board of directors' meetings, within one week from the date of the meeting.
8. A statement of the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, and the number of shares owned by each, as of the end of the fiscal year, within one week from the date of approval of the balance sheet.
9. A statement of the names of the individuals who have obtained loans or credit facilities, and the value of the loan or facility for each, and the guarantees provided, as of the end of the fiscal year, within one week from the date of approval of the balance sheet.
10. Any other data or documents requested by the Ministry."

**Article Two**

A new article, No. (2 bis), shall be added to the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds, with the following text:
"The entities subject to the provisions of Law No. 1 of 1993 referred to above shall enable the Ministry's employees, who are designated by a decision from the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>, to review the records, books, and documents to verify the correctness of the data and documents stipulated in the preceding article."

**Article Three**

This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

**Dr. Abdullah Issa Al-Salman <orig>د. عبد الله عيسى السلمان</orig>**
**Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>**

Issued on: 28 Jumada al-Akhirah 1442 H
Corresponding to: 10 February 2021 AD

# Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> announces Tender No. (09-2024/2025) concerning the maintenance of the Authority's website and technical support.
Companies wishing to participate may obtain the documents from the Financial Affairs Department - Ground Floor, Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> building in Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>, Block (2), Annex (1), during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 19/1/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) (only / seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
Bids shall be submitted to the headquarters of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> located in Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>, accompanied by an initial deposit of 1,000 K.D. in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee or a certified check issued by a local bank. Alternative offers will not be accepted. The letter of guarantee must be valid for the duration of the bids, for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of opening the envelopes. Bids for the financial and technical offer must be placed inside a single envelope sealed with red wax. The envelopes shall be addressed on the outside with the address of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>, mentioning the subject as indicated above, while avoiding the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 2/2/2025.
All participants in this tender must attend the preliminary meeting to be held on Thursday, 23/1/2025, at 10:30 AM at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption (Nazaha) <orig>نزاهة</orig> - Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>. The participant shall be bound by the minutes of the meeting and all documents of this tender, whether they attend this meeting or not.
The Secretary-General <orig>الأمين العام</orig>

# Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> announces Tender No. (H.M.S/17/2024-2025) concerning the provision of laboratory consumables for the laboratories of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions and specifications contained in the tender documents. These documents can be obtained from the Authority's main building in the Sabah Al-Salem <orig>صباح السالم</orig> area / Financial Affairs Department, Fifth Floor, Building A, during official working hours, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). Bids are to be placed in the designated box at the Authority's headquarters. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. ### Announcement
The Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> announces its desire to issue Practice No. (16-2024/2025) for the supply, installation, and operation of an Information Technology Service Management (ITSM Tool) system. Specialized companies wishing to apply for this practice must observe the following:
- 1. The company must be registered with the Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig>.
- 2. The applying company must have experience in this field prior to the issuance of this announcement and provide proof thereof.
- 3. The Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> will begin distributing the terms of the practice starting from the date of this announcement's publication for a period of 10 days.

## Announcement No. 2025/3
The holder of the following license has applied to the Municipality:
<table_caption>License Details for Mohammed and Al-Mousawi Company</table_caption>
<table>
| Trade Name | Mohammed and Al-Mousawi Company for Construction Materials and General Contracting |
|:---|:---|
| Category | Municipality Contractor, Category A |
| Registration No.      | 4000038 |
</table>
requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in exchange for its classification.
Pursuant to Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel their classification, and the committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the fulfillment of the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the specified period.

On behalf of the Director General of the Municipality

Announcement

## Annual Plan for Supply, Contracting, and Services Contracts
